View Nearby Businesses» Send to Phone Email Listing Print Listing View Hours View Menu Website Read Reviews (13) View Map/Directions
Information From the Restaurant Offers
Description: Pink's Hot Dogs is a Hot Dogs , American , and Fast Food restaurant where most Menuism users came for a meal on the go , paid less than $10 , and tipped between 15% to 18% . Tags: Hot Dogs, American, Fast Food, Meat, Burgers, and Delivery Stats: 91 dishes entered by diners at Pink's Hot Dogs 3 users want to eat at Pink's Hot Dogs 4 users love Pink's Hot Dogs Tips: Don't eat meat? No worries: Pink's offers turkey dogs as well as vegetarian hamburger patties. There is a small free lot behind Pink's, but it can sometimes be difficult and time-consuming to get in and out.
Nothing yet.
Do you own Pink's Hot Dogs? Contact us to connect with your diners.

"My favorite animal is steak. -- Fran Lebowitz"
39 helpful votes over 24 reviews siacali 24 Restaurant Reviews +39
Add as friend Send Msg Pink's Hot Dogs siacali November 6, 2007 5.0 5.0 star rating +4 0 +4 4 Votes Hotdogs, L.A. Style
Pinks–it’s not just hotdogs, it’s an institution. It’s been featured in movies, stars’and politicians’limos regularly stop by to pick up food, and there’s almost always a huge line.
So, what’s the attraction? Pinks is the ultimate in hotdogs. Bite into a Pinks dog, and you’ll note the perfect hotdog flavor, the nice crunch of the skin, and the tender insides. If you’re a true hotdog afficionado, it’s the best. It’s hotdog perfection.
Pinks also offers endless varieties of hotdog dishes for your dining pleasure. Pinks offers a wide variety of dogs (regular, footlong, polish hot or mild, jalapeño, turkey, tofu, etc), prepared in a wide range of creative configurations.
My favorite, for example, is the Double- Poli-Bacon Burrito Dog. It features a pair of hot or mild polish dogs, sliced open, layered on top of melted cheese, wrapped in bacon, covered in chili and wrapped in a burrito. Pure heaven.
BTW …even better the next day, chilled, the chili solidifies (congeals?) and you can slice it into round pieces….Yum!
Pinks has something for everyone. There are chicken dishes, hamburgers, and even vegetarian dishes available.
Dishes I tried:
Double Poli-Bacon Burrito Dog
5.0 star rating
A pair of hot or mild polish dogs, sliced open, layered on top of melted cheese, wrapped in bacon, covered in chili and wrapped in a burrito. Link To Review

Add as friend Send Msg Pink's Hot Dogs LAGary December 25, 2008 1.0 1.0 star rating +2 3 +2 2 Votes The most unreliably hyped and overrated restaurant in L.A...
I am a hot dog lover and I can’t tell you how many people have over the years told me to eat at Pink’s. I finally did, and the disappointment on my face was visible from bite number 1. I believe that no one that told me to go to Pink’s ever had the hotdog at Costco.
Let’s start now with the many problems at Pink’s and to make it easy to read—I will sequentially number them: 1) Take out a dime from your pocket. Your Pink’s hotdog will not be thicker than the diameter of your dime. It will disappear between the buns. You will wonder if there is a hotdog in your bun. 2) No worries if you burnt your taste buds the day before—the Pink’s hotdog is tasteless. It is the most tasteless hotdog I have ever had in over 35 years of eating hotdogs all over the world, on streets, fairs, and deli’s. 3) Be prepared for a line at all times. The staff monitors the line and will slow down service, and sometimes walk away to make sure that there is always at least two lines in front of the shack so that it looks busy and desirable to everyone passing by or waiting. 4) There are magicians working at Pink’s who have made real chili disappear and reappear as watered down, tasteless slop on your hotdog. I ordered Chili! on the dog and I have no idea what that brown watery stuff was. 5) The Pink’s $5.00 commandment: There shall be no hotdog on the menu that shall sell for less than $5.00. The $5.00 hotdog without anything on it at the ballpark is way, way better my friends. 6) There is nothing fun, exciting or nostalgic about eating at this dump.
So, the next time someone tells YOU to go to Pink’s, claiming that it is such a great hotdog, and they have recently been there—just do one thing: DO NOT trust anything that person ever tells you about food again!
Dishes I tried:
Chili Cheese Dog
1.0 star rating
Don’t do it—You have been warned! Link To Review

pleasurepalate 12/26/2008 "Menuism Community Manager"
201 helpful votes over 94 reviews 94 +201 This number is the number of useful votes pleasurepalate has. The more useful votes, the more you can trust the quality of reviews. Since you’re a hot dog lover, I’d love to read about hot dog places you’d actually recommend? :)
LAGary (Author) 12/27/2008 4 helpful votes over 2 reviews 2 +4 This number is the number of useful votes LAGary has. The more useful votes, the more you can trust the quality of reviews. Hi PleasurePalate,
Here in the LA area, one of the best hotdogs ever is remarkably, the COSTCO food court hotdog. Wherever I have lived, or traveled, if I pass a COSTCO , I stop for the hotdog. It tastes the same all over. It has only been $1.50 for past many years, is 100% beef, and from the highest quality hotdog manufacturer in the USA : Hebrew National. It is perfectly spiced, very large and if you ask, they will give you the Sauerkraut to put on it. I really don’t know how they can bring this hotdog in at $1.50. The same brand hotdog is over $3.00 and closer to $4.00 at most deli’s. If the COSTCO food court is outside (some store food courts are outside, some are not), you do not have to be a member to eat there. They never ask for your card. The other hotdog, which is great, is the Dodger Kosher 100% hotdog. If you are in the mood for a $6.00 hotdog at the ball game—you can’t go wrong.
pleasurepalate 12/28/2008 "Menuism Community Manager"
201 helpful votes over 94 reviews 94 +201 This number is the number of useful votes pleasurepalate has. The more useful votes, the more you can trust the quality of reviews. I totally agree. Costco hots are pretty darn good. :)

4 star rating
Classic Hot Dogs. I come here when ever
Classic Hot Dogs. I come here when ever I get a chance. I really enjoy all their hot dogs. I hate how there's rarely ever parking around there so you need to do a lot of walking. And there is usually a big line.
